definition: to stop on the way for a rest
to rest/to take a break/to stop/to halt/(dialect) to sleep/a moment/a short while
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role

sentences.english: It was a stopping point on the famous Silk Road between the East and the West .
sentences.chinese: 当时它是连接东西方的著名丝绸之路上的一个歇脚点。

sentences.english: She decided to stop and ask if she could rest there for the night.
sentences.chinese: 她决定停下来，问一问是否能在这里过夜歇歇脚。

sentences.english: I stopped at an old log hotel to quench a desert thirst.
sentences.chinese: 为了缓解沙漠之渴，我来到了一家木屋旅馆歇脚。

sentences.english: The oak bench was not just a foot rest.
sentences.chinese: 橡木长椅不仅仅是歇脚的地方。

sentences.english: If the pin is available only to, it can also sit in the shade of coffee Lane.
sentences.chinese: 如果只是想歇歇脚，那还可以到咖啡店里坐坐。

sentences.english: The period of Shangyuan is a rest stop for Du Fu in his late years of vagrant life.
sentences.chinese: 上元年间，是杜甫晚年漂泊生涯中的一个歇脚期。

sentences.english: They stopped at a little cafe and had a fondue.
sentences.chinese: 他们在一家小餐馆歇脚，吃了顿干酪火锅。

sentences.english: We found a perch on the ruins of a low stone wall.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到一处矮石墙的残垣，歇了歇脚。

sentences.english: I don't need much now, just a place to rest.
sentences.chinese: 现在我什么也不需要，只想找个地方歇歇脚。

sentences.english: Rose: Honey, mother needs a perch.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的，妈妈需要一个歇脚的地方。

definition: to lodge/to stay (for the night)
to stop for a snack while traveling
to have a rest/to stay for the night/to go to bed/to sleep
to rest/to relax/to take a break
to stay for a time/to stop over/to lodge/to sink down (into soft ground)/leftovers
to lodge/to stay (for the night)
to rest for a bit/to take a breather
relay station for post horses (old)
to sleep outdoors/to spend the night in the open
to stay at/to live in (temporarily)
lit. to avoid the wind/fig. to keep low to avoid a difficult situation/to stay out of trouble
to take shelter from the wind/to lie low/to stay out of trouble
to set up camp/Taiwan pr. [an1 ying2 zha2 zhai4]
to give shelter from the wind and rain/to keep out the elements
to stay with sb/to ask for lodging
tavern/guest house/inn/hotel
